verses.roman:
nityānanda-prabhu dui hāta prasāriyā
prabhure dharite cāhe āśa-pāśa dhāñā

synonyms: nityānanda-prabhu—Lord Nityānanda Prabhu; dui—two; hāta—hands; prasāriyā—stretching; prabhure—Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; dharite—to catch; cāhe—wants; āśa-pāśa—here and there; dhāñā—running.
translation: Nityānanda Prabhu would stretch out His two hands and try to catch the Lord when He was running here and there.
